alert.note: Alert for Southern Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin and central Essex Counties in New York through 545 PM EDT... At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Marcy, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moriah, Elizabethtown, Mount Marcy, Keene Valley, Witherbee, Underwood, Mount Van Hoevenberg, St. Huberts, Tahawus, Mineville, Mount Van Hoevenburg Recreation Area, Moriah Center and New Russia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern New York.
